titleStmt.title: An act for putting in execution an ordinance mentioned in this act.
Public General Acts. 1660.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by John Bill [and Christopher Barker], printer to the Kings most excellent Majesty,

notesStmt.note: Caption title; at head: Anno XII. Caroli II. Regis.

Imprint from general title page, which reads "Anno regni Caroli IJ. Regis Angliæ, Scotiæ, Franciæ, & Hiberniæ, duodecimo. At the Parliament begun at Westminster the five and twentieth day of April, an. Dom. 1660. ..". Barker's name from colophon.
Last word of first line of text: "His"; first word of line below initial: "pounds"; last word of last full line on page: "and". Signed on first page of text: A2.
The text is in the same setting as Wing E1050, which has "printed by John Bill and Christopher Barker" in title-page imprint.
Identified on film as Wing E1247b.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
